meanings: [명사] confrontation, [동사] confront, stand face to face (with)
[명사] substitution, replacement, [동사] substitute (sth for sth), replace (sth with sth), (formal) supplant

vlive.korean: [여전히 좀비와 대치 중인 정지미 팀] 왜 이렇게 많아! [Team JEONGxJIxMI is confronting against zombies] There are so many zombies! 듣기 View video TWICE : TWICE REALITY “TIME TO TWICE” – 대탈출 EP.02
vlive.english: [Team JEONGxJIxMI is confronting against zombies] There are so many zombies!

examples.korean: There were confrontations between local residents and the police. 발음듣기 지역 주민들과 경찰 사이에 대치 사태가 있었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: There were confrontations between local residents and the police. 발음

examples.korean: Butter can be substituted with margarine in this recipe. 발음듣기 이 조리법에서는 버터가 마가린으로 대치될 수 있다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Butter can be substituted with margarine in this recipe. 발음

examples.korean: The two opposing armies faced each other across the battlefield. 발음듣기 대치 중인 두 군대가 싸움터를 사이에 두고 서로 마주했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The two opposing armies faced each other across the battlefield. 발음

examples.korean: The protesters and police stood eyeball to eyeball. 발음듣기 시위대들과 경찰은 바로 얼굴을 맞대고 대치 중이었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The protesters and police stood eyeball to eyeball. 발음

examples.korean: There was a head-on confrontation between management and unions. 발음듣기 노사간에 정면 대치 사태가 벌어졌다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: There was a head-on confrontation between management and unions. 발음
